lines.content: * Duke is a task management application that allows users to manage their tasks.
* It provides a command-line interface for users to interact with their task list.
* Enumeration representing possible commands in Duke.
BYE, LIST, MARK, DELETE, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, UNKNOWN
* Constructs a Duke instance with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The file path for loading and saving tasks.
* Runs the Duke application, allowing users to interact with their task list.
* The main entry point for the Duke application.
* @param args Command-line arguments (not used in this application).
* Represents exceptions specific to the Duke program.
* Constructs a DukeException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message (which is saved for later retrieval
* Exception class for an empty description in a Todo task.
* This exception is thrown when attempting to create a Todo task with an empty description.
public static class EmptyTodoDescriptionException extends DukeException {
* Constructs an EmptyTodoDescriptionException with a default message.
* The default message is "OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty."
super("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Exception class for an unknown command.
* This exception is thrown when an unknown command is encountered in the Duke program.
public static class UnknownCommandException extends DukeException {
* Constructs an UnknownCommandException with a default message.
* The default message is "OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(".
super("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Parser class parses user input and executes corresponding commands.
* Provides methods to handle various commands such as adding tasks, marking tasks as done, etc.
* Parses user input and executes the corresponding command.
* @param userInput The user input to be parsed and executed.
* @param tasks     The TaskList object to perform operations on.
* @param ui        The Ui object for user interface interactions.
* @param storage   The Storage object for saving and loading tasks.
* @throws DukeException If an error occurs during the parsing or execution of the command.
public static void parseAndExecute(String userInput, TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {

throw new DukeException("The task number to mark is missing.");
throw new DukeException("The task number to mark is missing.");
throw new DukeException("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means.");

* Parses a line from a saved file and constructs a Task object.

public static void parseFind( TaskList tasks, Ui ui) {

* Storage class handles the loading and saving of tasks to a file.

file.getParentFile().mkdirs(); // Create parent directories if they don't exist
